intro: Chamaeriphes macrosperma, commonly known as the giant tamarack, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Santalaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. Its seeds are enclosed in a fleshy, orange-red fruit that attracts various seed-dispersing animals. Chamaeriphes macrosperma plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to biodiversity and soil stability.
